title: New Comic: Fortune Smiles

embed.description: Bilgewater. A haven for Runeterra's most notorious monster hunters, mercenaries, and scoundrels. For decades, a ruthless pirate named Gangplank kept the city in check. Under his merciless rule, Bilgewater was an orderly place to make a dishonest living. But now Gangplank is dead. Murdered, by a crimson-haired bounty hunter seeking vengeance for her parents' deaths.

body: Well, would you look at that.

replies.body:
This is the Miss Fortune that we need to see in-game. Not the over-sexualized harlot who just makes jokes about lust (since that's Eve's thing now). 

Miss Fortune is just as much brutal as Gangplank was, mixed with the unpredictability of a blood-thirsty killer who can hide behind a mask. Gangplank will have one hell of a battle with the redhead to take back Bilgewater, and he's pulling out all the stops to do so.

Be prepared. Bilgewater is gonna get spicy.

It's strange that one of the beta champs have had very little lore love throughout the years. Even back in the Institute days, Annie was absent from lore material. And now, we can't even be sure what little lore she has is canon.

It sucks because of her young age, she has a decent amount of potential directions they can take her story. It would be nice if the lore team gave her at least half the love the skins team give her.

Ikr. Make her parents former members of the black rose or members of rivals of the black rose. They could even make annie some kind of " the child of the profecy" kind of character. How would *she* feel about being some prophecy child? Would *she* know? Would *she* even care? How does being a prophecy child affect her childhood? How does it affect her motivations, goals & story?

I'd personally like to see some comics for {{champion:43}} or {{champion:7}}

Also, Harker is an idiot. He says he betrayed Fortune because he wanted her pistols. But if he didn't betrayed her, he would had her in his bed. And probably more than one night. So...
Her pistols...
She on your bed...
Her pistols...
She on your bed...

*takes the pistols*

[In the words of a famous templar:](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ubw5N8iVDHI)
It's kind of implied Sarah had no intention of actually honoring her end of the bargain. Bringing her to bed is probably a good way of dying there.

I don't have it so clear. She said she needed his support in the council for her own interests. What good would make to her killing him then? It would only put the rest against her. She only chose to kill them when she had no other choice left.

I'm a bit disappointed that the comic is about Miss fortune who might have the most  canon lore at the moment,but overall I think the story was pretty neat,as it fleshed out Bilgewater quite a bit and I really liked how MF and Harker tried to deceive one another and that MF tried to be diplomatic about this(though i am sad that we never got to know why Harker didn't want to ally himself with Fortune)

Probably because of the whole, "Blew up Gangplank"

There's a reason that the three of them wanted her out of the picture. She's a wild card that none of them can predict benefits from. The devil you know is better than the devil you don't. 

Or maybe overconfidence. Maybe he felt that removing her could boost his own reputation and lead him to eventually ruling Bilgewater. After all, his original fame came from lying about his accomplishment.

Also the fact that she blew up Gangplank and is _a woman_.  In this kind of boys' club, never underestimate the power of plain old sexism as a motivator.  A strong woman who gets stuff done scares them (with good reason, I'd be scared of Miss Fortune too), so they want her gone to preserve the status quo.  

Also, they've implied that the old lore of Gangplank killing his abusive father is still largely canon.  Illaoi's lore story confirmed at least that he didn't exactly have a great "father-son relationship".  That, and things going sour with the Serpent Priestess are what put the massive chip on his shoulder.  Probably some innate power hunger there too, I'm sure.
